intro: Corallocarpus angosturensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf corallocarpus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels and feature five petals, often with a distinctive coloration. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
